result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Lee Lindenbolt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (8th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus all costs, penalties and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC out of up to 25% of prision wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two (2) years of Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:  to be determined by DOC, but to include those as listed.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screes.  No positive results. Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to revocation.  IID surcharge and/or fees to apply.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Defendant's pro se petition for half priced IID.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 10/01/14. AR

Defendant Eric Lee Lindenbolt in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA St. Junior). Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.     Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   

Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $600.00  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges to be collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 3 years.
Court ordered ignition interlock for a period 3 years, consecutive to revocation.  IID surcharges and/or fees to apply.  

 The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 5 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:  
 

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge and IID surcharges and fees, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years of his initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Eric Lee Lindenbolt in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA St. Junior).  Defendant no longer wishes to plead guilty and request trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Eric Lee Lindenbolt in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
